title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 29 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on 1 Chronicles chapter 29 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 29 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of 1 Chronicles Chapter 29.

questions.question: Who did David say God had chosen to build the house of the LORD?
questions.correctAnswer: Solomon
questions.explanation: David states that Solomon his son, whom alone God hath chosen, is appointed for the work (1 Chronicles 29:1).

questions.question: What materials did David prepare for the house of God?
options: Gold, silver, brass, iron, wood, onyx stones
questions.correctAnswer: Gold, silver, brass, iron, wood, onyx stones
questions.explanation: David prepared gold, silver, brass, iron, wood, onyx stones, and various precious stones for the house of God (1 Chronicles 29:2).

questions.question: How many talents of gold did David give over and above all he had prepared?
questions.correctAnswer: Three thousand talents
questions.explanation: David gave three thousand talents of gold, of the gold of Ophir, above all he had prepared (1 Chronicles 29:4).

questions.question: Who received the precious stones given for the house of the LORD?
questions.correctAnswer: Jehiel the Gershonite
questions.explanation: Those with precious stones gave them to the treasure of the house of the LORD by the hand of Jehiel the Gershonite (1 Chronicles 29:8).

questions.question: What was the reaction of the people when they offered willingly to the LORD?
questions.correctAnswer: They rejoiced with perfect heart
questions.explanation: The people rejoiced because they offered willingly with a perfect heart; David also rejoiced with great joy (1 Chronicles 29:9).

questions.question: What did David bless before all the congregation?
options: The LORD God of Israel our father
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD God of Israel our father
questions.explanation: David blessed the LORD God of Israel his father before all the congregation (1 Chronicles 29:10).

questions.question: According to David's prayer, what comes from the LORD?
questions.correctAnswer: Riches and honor
questions.explanation: David states that both riches and honor come from the LORD, and He reigns over all (1 Chronicles 29:12).

questions.question: How does David describe the people and himself in relation to God?
questions.correctAnswer: Strangers and sojourners
questions.explanation: David describes them as strangers and sojourners before God, with days on earth like a shadow (1 Chronicles 29:15).

questions.question: What did David ask the LORD to give Solomon?
options: A perfect heart to keep God's commandments
questions.correctAnswer: A perfect heart to keep God's commandments
questions.explanation: David prayed that Solomon would have a perfect heart to keep God's commandments and build the palace (1 Chronicles 29:19).

questions.question: Who was anointed priest when Solomon was made king the second time?
questions.correctAnswer: Zadok
questions.explanation: Zadok was anointed to be priest when Solomon was anointed king the second time (1 Chronicles 29:22).

questions.question: True or False: David reigned over Israel for forty years.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: David reigned over Israel for forty years, seven in Hebron and thirty-three in Jerusalem (1 Chronicles 29:27).

questions.question: True or False: David died in his youth with little honor.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: David died in a good old age, full of days, riches, and honor (1 Chronicles 29:28).

questions.question: True or False: The people blessed the LORD God of their fathers and worshipped the LORD and the king after David's speech.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: After David's speech, the congregation blessed the LORD God of their fathers, bowed their heads, and worshipped the LORD and the king (1 Chronicles 29:20).

questions.question: Complete the verse: 'For all things come of thee, and of thine own have we _________ thee.'
questions.correctAnswer: given
questions.explanation: David acknowledges that all things come from God and they have given from His own (1 Chronicles 29:14).

questions.question: Complete the verse: 'Now therefore, our God, we thank thee, and praise thy ________ name.'
questions.correctAnswer: glorious
questions.explanation: David thanks God and praises His glorious name (1 Chronicles 29:13).

medium.title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 29 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from 1 Chronicles Chapter 29 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does 1 Chronicles 29 teach us about generosity and stewardship in contributing to God's work?
options: We should give willingly and from our own blessings
Only kings and leaders are responsible for giving
Giving is optional and not important
We should only give small amounts to avoid loss
questions.correctAnswer: We should give willingly and from our own blessings
questions.explanation: David and the leaders gave willingly and from their own possessions to God's house (1 Chronicles 29:3-7), encouraging a willing heart in giving (29:9). This shows generosity and stewardship as acts of faith and devotion.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with contentment amid wealth. Based on 1 Chronicles 29, what biblical truth would you share?
options: All riches come from God and should be used for His purposes
We should hoard wealth for personal security
Riches are evil and must be rejected completely
Wealth is a sign of personal superiority
questions.correctAnswer: All riches come from God and should be used for His purposes
questions.explanation: David acknowledges that riches and honor come from God and that everything belongs to Him (1 Chronicles 29:11-12, 29:16), teaching contentment and proper stewardship.

questions.question: What does 1 Chronicles 29 teach about the importance of praying for leaders?
options: We should pray that leaders have a perfect heart to obey God
Leaders do not need prayer because they are chosen by people
Only priests need to be prayed for
Prayer is unnecessary for government matters
questions.correctAnswer: We should pray that leaders have a perfect heart to obey God
questions.explanation: David prays for Solomon to have a perfect heart to keep God's commandments and build the temple (1 Chronicles 29:19), highlighting the importance of praying for the spiritual integrity of leaders.

questions.question: How does this chapter illustrate humility in recognizing our place before God?
options: We are strangers and sojourners on earth, dependent on God's grace
We are masters of our own destiny without needing God
Our strength comes from our own power
questions.correctAnswer: We are strangers and sojourners on earth, dependent on God's grace
questions.explanation: David acknowledges human frailty and temporariness before God, saying our days are as a shadow and we are strangers (1 Chronicles 29:14-15), teaching humility.

questions.question: Based on 1 Chronicles 29, how should believers respond when they are asked to serve God in the church?
options: With willing hearts and joyful offering of their gifts
Only if they are paid for their service
questions.correctAnswer: With willing hearts and joyful offering of their gifts
questions.explanation: The people and leaders offered willingly and with joy to serve God’s house (1 Chronicles 29:6-9, 29:17), teaching that service should come from the heart.

questions.question: A believer is anxious about their daily work and its value. What can 1 Chronicles 29 teach about work and integrity?
options: Work done with uprightness pleases God
Work is unimportant and should be avoided
Only spiritual work matters, not physical labor
questions.correctAnswer: Work done with uprightness pleases God
questions.explanation: David says God tests the heart and has pleasure in uprightness, showing that honest and sincere work honors God (1 Chronicles 29:17).

questions.question: True or False: David asked the people to bless the LORD after their offerings and worship.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: David commanded the congregation to bless the LORD, and they obeyed by bowing and worshiping (1 Chronicles 29:20), demonstrating gratitude and reverence after giving.

questions.question: True or False: Solomon was anointed king before David died according to 1 Chronicles 29.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Solomon was anointed king the day after the offerings were made, before David's death (1 Chronicles 29:22), showing orderly succession and God's timing.

questions.question: How does 1 Chronicles 29 teach about gratitude in prayer?
options: We should thank God for all His greatness and blessings
Prayer should only ask for personal needs
Only priests should give thanks in prayer
questions.correctAnswer: We should thank God for all His greatness and blessings
questions.explanation: David blesses and thanks God for His greatness, power, and provision (1 Chronicles 29:10-13), modeling grateful prayer for believers.

questions.question: A believer is concerned about lasting impact. What biblical truth does 1 Chronicles 29 offer about legacy?
options: God magnifies those who obey and serve Him, leaving a lasting legacy
Only military power secures a legacy
Legacy is determined by wealth alone
Legacy cannot be influenced by faith
questions.correctAnswer: God magnifies those who obey and serve Him, leaving a lasting legacy
questions.explanation: The LORD magnified Solomon with royal majesty and all Israel obeyed him (1 Chronicles 29:25), illustrating blessings and legacy from faithfulness to God.

questions.question: How should believers view their possessions according to 1 Chronicles 29?
options: All possessions come from God and are to be used for His purposes
Possessions are earned solely by personal effort
We must keep all possessions for ourselves
questions.correctAnswer: All possessions come from God and are to be used for His purposes
questions.explanation: David acknowledges that everything is God's and giving back is from what He has provided (1 Chronicles 29:14, 29:16), teaching stewardship and surrender.

questions.question: How does 1 Chronicles 29 encourage believers to persevere through trials?
options: By trusting God's sovereignty and preparing hearts to obey Him
By relying on their own strength and ignoring God
questions.correctAnswer: By trusting God's sovereignty and preparing hearts to obey Him
questions.explanation: David prays for God's people to have their hearts prepared to serve Him (1 Chronicles 29:18), encouraging trust and spiritual readiness amid challenges.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: "David blessed the LORD before all the congregation, saying, 'Blessed be thou, ________, God of Israel our father, for ever and ever.'"
questions.correctAnswer: LORD
questions.explanation: David's blessing starts with 'Blessed be thou, LORD God of Israel our father' as recorded in 1 Chronicles 29:10, emphasizing God's sovereign name.

questions.question: What biblical virtue is demonstrated by the leaders offering vast amounts of gold, silver, brass, and iron for the temple?
options: Generosity and willingness to serve God
questions.correctAnswer: Generosity and willingness to serve God
questions.explanation: The leaders gave large amounts willingly for God's house (1 Chronicles 29:6-7), modeling generosity and dedicated service.

questions.question: According to 1 Chronicles 29, what should believers recognize about the permanence of life?
options: Our days on earth are as a shadow; nothing is permanent
questions.correctAnswer: Our days on earth are as a shadow; nothing is permanent
questions.explanation: David states that life is fleeting and we are sojourners on earth (1 Chronicles 29:15), teaching humility and reliance on God.

hard.title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 29 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from 1 Chronicles Chapter 29.

questions.question: In 1 Chronicles 29, David refers to the palace as being for whom?
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD God
questions.explanation: David explicitly states in 1 Chronicles 29:1 that the palace is not for man, but for the LORD God.

questions.question: What materials did David prepare in abundance for the house of God according to 1 Chronicles 29?
options: Gold, silver, brass, iron, wood, and precious stones
questions.correctAnswer: Gold, silver, brass, iron, wood, and precious stones
questions.explanation: Verse 2 details how David prepared gold, silver, brass, iron, wood, onyx stones, glistering stones, and precious stones for the house of God.

questions.question: What was the significance of David giving of his own proper good to the house of God beyond what he had prepared?
options: It showed his personal devotion and generosity
It was a payment for services
It was a requirement by the priests
questions.correctAnswer: It showed his personal devotion and generosity
questions.explanation: David’s offering of his own resources beyond what he prepared reflects his heartfelt dedication, as stated in 1 Chronicles 29:3.

questions.question: How much gold did David offer from Ophir for the overlaying of the walls?
questions.correctAnswer: Three thousand talents
questions.explanation: According to 1 Chronicles 29:4, David offered three thousand talents of gold from Ophir for overlaying the walls.

questions.question: Who were the primary contributors alongside David for the service of the house of God?
options: Chiefs of the fathers, princes of tribes, captains of thousands and hundreds, and rulers of the king's work
questions.correctAnswer: Chiefs of the fathers, princes of tribes, captains of thousands and hundreds, and rulers of the king's work
questions.explanation: Verse 6 describes these leaders as those who offered willingly alongside David.

questions.question: Which individual was responsible for receiving the precious stones given to the house of the LORD?
questions.correctAnswer: Jehiel the Gershonite
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 29:8 states that those with precious stones gave them to the house’s treasure through Jehiel the Gershonite.

questions.question: David's prayer of blessing in 1 Chronicles 29:10-12 emphasizes several attributes of God. Which of the following is NOT among them?
questions.correctAnswer: Immortality
questions.explanation: David blesses God for greatness, power, glory, victory, majesty, kingdom, and exaltation but does not specifically mention immortality in these verses.

questions.question: In 1 Chronicles 29:14, what theological truth does David express about giving?
options: All things come from God and what we give is from His own
Giving is optional and not required
We earn our possessions through hard work
Only priests should give to the temple
questions.correctAnswer: All things come from God and what we give is from His own
questions.explanation: David acknowledges that both he and his people can only give because everything originally comes from God, as stated in verse 14.

questions.question: What metaphor does David use in 1 Chronicles 29:15 to describe human life in relation to God's eternity?
options: Our days are as a shadow
Life is like a flowing river
We are trees planted by water
questions.correctAnswer: Our days are as a shadow
questions.explanation: Verse 15 compares human life to a shadow, highlighting its fleeting nature before God’s eternal presence.

questions.question: David prays for Solomon in 1 Chronicles 29:19 to have a perfect heart to do what specific task?
options: Keep God's commandments and build the palace
questions.correctAnswer: Keep God's commandments and build the palace
questions.explanation: David asks God to give Solomon a perfect heart to keep commandments and build the palace, as per verse 19.

questions.question: What was the people's response after David’s blessing and prayer in 1 Chronicles 29:20?
options: They blessed the LORD God, bowed down, and worshipped the LORD and the king
questions.correctAnswer: They blessed the LORD God, bowed down, and worshipped the LORD and the king
questions.explanation: Verse 20 describes the congregation’s worshipful response to David’s blessing.

questions.question: How many bullocks, rams, and lambs were sacrificed the day after David's blessing according to 1 Chronicles 29?
options: One thousand each of bullocks, rams, and lambs
questions.correctAnswer: One thousand each of bullocks, rams, and lambs
questions.explanation: Verse 21 specifies that a thousand bullocks, rams, and lambs were sacrificed with drink offerings.

questions.question: True or False: Solomon was anointed to be the chief governor before he was made king again in 1 Chronicles 29.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: According to verse 22, Solomon was anointed unto the LORD to be the chief governor before being made king the second time.

questions.question: What is highlighted about Solomon’s reign in 1 Chronicles 29:25?
options: He was magnified exceedingly with royal majesty never seen before
He ruled for only seven years
questions.correctAnswer: He was magnified exceedingly with royal majesty never seen before
questions.explanation: Verse 25 emphasizes that the LORD magnified Solomon exceedingly with unprecedented royal majesty.

questions.question: According to 1 Chronicles 29:27, how long did David reign over Israel in Jerusalem?
questions.correctAnswer: Thirty-three years
questions.explanation: David reigned seven years in Hebron and thirty-three years in Jerusalem, totaling forty years (verse 27).

theological.title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 29 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from 1 Chronicles Chapter 29 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to 1 Chronicles 29, why did David emphasize that the palace Solomon was to build was not for man but for the LORD God?
options: Because the work was sacred and dedicated to God alone
Because Solomon was too young to rule
Because the palace was meant to house the king's treasures
Because the palace was a symbol of earthly power
questions.correctAnswer: Because the work was sacred and dedicated to God alone
questions.explanation: David states in 1 Chronicles 29:1 that the palace is not for man but for the LORD God, emphasizing the sacred purpose of the building as God's house. This reflects the biblical principle that God’s dwelling is holy and set apart (Exodus 25:8, 1 Kings 8:27, Hebrews 9:11, John 2:19-21).

questions.question: What kinds of materials did David prepare for the house of God, as recorded in 1 Chronicles 29?
options: Gold, silver, brass, iron, wood, and precious stones
questions.correctAnswer: Gold, silver, brass, iron, wood, and precious stones
questions.explanation: David prepared all kinds of materials including gold, silver, brass, iron, wood, onyx, and precious stones (1 Chronicles 29:2). This shows the abundant resources dedicated to God's temple, consistent with the detailed materials used for the tabernacle and temple (Exodus 25:3-7, 1 Kings 6:7, 2 Chronicles 3:8, Revelation 21:18-21).

questions.question: In 1 Chronicles 29, how did the leaders and people respond to David’s call to give for the house of God?
options: They gave willingly and with perfect heart
They were reluctant but gave out of duty
They gave only after being compelled
questions.correctAnswer: They gave willingly and with perfect heart
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 29:6-9 describes how the leaders and people offered willingly with perfect hearts, demonstrating joyful generosity. This aligns with the biblical teaching on cheerful giving (2 Corinthians 9:7, Exodus 35:21, Proverbs 3:9, Acts 20:35).

questions.question: What does David attribute the ability to give so generously to the LORD to, according to 1 Chronicles 29:14?
options: That all things come from God and we give from His own
questions.correctAnswer: That all things come from God and we give from His own
questions.explanation: David acknowledges in 1 Chronicles 29:14 that all things come from God and what they give is from what He has provided. This reflects the theological truth of God's sovereign provision (James 1:17, Psalm 24:1, Deuteronomy 8:18, 1 Corinthians 4:7).

questions.question: How does David describe human life in relation to God’s eternal nature in 1 Chronicles 29:15?
options: As strangers and sojourners whose days are like a shadow
As rulers over the earth with eternal reign
As gods in their own right
questions.correctAnswer: As strangers and sojourners whose days are like a shadow
questions.explanation: David describes humanity as strangers and sojourners, with days on earth as a shadow (1 Chronicles 29:15), emphasizing human mortality contrasted with God’s eternal nature (Psalm 39:12, Hebrews 11:13, James 4:14, 1 Peter 2:11).

questions.question: What does David confess about God's knowledge of the heart and his own offering in 1 Chronicles 29:17?
options: God tries the heart and takes pleasure in uprightness, and David offered willingly
God only accepts offerings from priests
God does not care about the heart but only the offering
questions.correctAnswer: God tries the heart and takes pleasure in uprightness, and David offered willingly
questions.explanation: David states God tries the heart and delights in uprightness, and that he offered all willingly (1 Chronicles 29:17). This reflects biblical emphasis on sincerity and integrity in worship (1 Samuel 16:7, Proverbs 21:2, Psalm 51:6, 2 Corinthians 8:12).

questions.question: What prayer does David make for Solomon in 1 Chronicles 29:19?
options: That Solomon would have a perfect heart to keep God's commandments and build the palace
That Solomon would defeat all his enemies
That Solomon would reign for many years
That Solomon would have great wealth
questions.correctAnswer: That Solomon would have a perfect heart to keep God's commandments and build the palace
questions.explanation: David prays that Solomon would have a perfect heart to obey God and build the temple (1 Chronicles 29:19). This prayer underscores the biblical ideal of godly leadership and obedience (Deuteronomy 6:5, Psalm 101:2, Proverbs 3:5-6, James 1:5).

questions.question: How did the people express their blessing to the LORD and David in 1 Chronicles 29:20?
options: They blessed the LORD, bowed their heads, and worshipped
questions.correctAnswer: They blessed the LORD, bowed their heads, and worshipped
questions.explanation: The people blessed the LORD, bowed their heads, and worshipped (1 Chronicles 29:20), showing reverence and submission consistent with worship practices (Psalm 95:6, Nehemiah 8:6, Matthew 26:39, Philippians 2:10-11).

questions.question: What significant event regarding Solomon is recorded in 1 Chronicles 29:22?
options: Solomon was made king a second time and anointed
questions.correctAnswer: Solomon was made king a second time and anointed
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 29:22 records Solomon being made king a second time and anointed, signifying divine approval and continuity of David's dynasty, which connects to messianic promises (1 Kings 1:39, Psalm 2:6, Isaiah 9:6, Luke 1:32).

questions.question: According to 1 Chronicles 29:25, how did the LORD regard Solomon in the sight of all Israel?
options: The LORD magnified Solomon exceedingly and gave him royal majesty unmatched by any king before
The LORD punished Solomon for his sins
The LORD made Solomon a common ruler
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD magnified Solomon exceedingly and gave him royal majesty unmatched by any king before
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 29:25 states the LORD magnified Solomon exceedingly, bestowing a unique royal majesty, highlighting God's sovereign blessing on his rule (Psalm 72:1-7, 1 Kings 3:12, Isaiah 11:1-5, Hebrews 1:8).

questions.question: How long did David reign over Israel according to 1 Chronicles 29:27?
options: Forty years; seven in Hebron and thirty-three in Jerusalem
Twenty years; split equally between two cities
questions.correctAnswer: Forty years; seven in Hebron and thirty-three in Jerusalem
questions.explanation: David reigned forty years total, seven in Hebron and thirty-three in Jerusalem (1 Chronicles 29:27). This historical detail aligns with 2 Samuel 5:5 and confirms the biblical record of David's kingship.

questions.question: What is said about David’s death in 1 Chronicles 29:28?
options: He died in a good old age, full of days, riches, and honour
He died young and in battle
questions.correctAnswer: He died in a good old age, full of days, riches, and honour
questions.explanation: David died in a good old age, full of days, riches, and honour (1 Chronicles 29:28), reflecting a blessed life and God's favor, consistent with biblical depictions of a righteous life (Psalm 91:16, Proverbs 3:1-2, Job 42:16, Acts 7:45).

questions.question: What books record the acts of King David according to 1 Chronicles 29:29?
options: The book of Samuel the seer, the book of Nathan the prophet, and the book of Gad the seer
The book of Moses, the book of Joshua, and the book of Judges
The book of Isaiah, the book of Jeremiah, and the book of Ezekiel
The book of Psalms, the book of Proverbs, and the book of Ecclesiastes
questions.correctAnswer: The book of Samuel the seer, the book of Nathan the prophet, and the book of Gad the seer
questions.explanation: David’s acts are recorded in the books of Samuel, Nathan, and Gad (1 Chronicles 29:29), showing the prophetic witness to his reign, consistent with Old Testament historiography and prophetic literature (2 Samuel 12:1-7, 1 Kings 1:1-53, 1 Chronicles 21:9-12).

questions.question: What attributes of God are highlighted in David’s blessing in 1 Chronicles 29:11?
options: Greatness, power, glory, victory, majesty, and exalted headship over all
questions.correctAnswer: Greatness, power, glory, victory, majesty, and exalted headship over all
questions.explanation: David blesses God for His greatness, power, glory, victory, majesty, and exalted position (1 Chronicles 29:11), reflecting biblical affirmations of God's sovereignty and dominion (Psalm 145:3, Isaiah 40:25-26, Revelation 19:6, Colossians 1:16-17).

questions.question: What theological truth about God’s reign does David affirm in 1 Chronicles 29:12?
options: God reigns over all, and in His hand is power to make great and give strength
God’s power is limited by human will
questions.correctAnswer: God reigns over all, and in His hand is power to make great and give strength
questions.explanation: David acknowledges God’s universal reign and sovereign power to exalt and strengthen (1 Chronicles 29:12), consistent with biblical teaching on God's omnipotence and kingship (Psalm 103:19, Daniel 4:34-35, Ephesians 1:20-22, Revelation 11:15).
